action.action-desc: Mr. Tonko (for himself, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, and Ms. Waters) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To extend the National Alzheimer’s Project.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the NAPA Reauthorization Act.
Section 2 of the National Alzheimer's Project Act (42 U.S.C. 11225) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking and coordination of and inserting on, and coordination of,;

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as subparagraphs (B) and (C), respectively; and
by inserting before subparagraph (B), as so redesignated, the following:

subparagraph.text: promotion of healthy aging and reduction of risk factors for Alzheimer's disease;
in paragraph (5), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (7); and
by inserting after paragraph (5) the following:

paragraph.text: provide information on, and promote the adoption of, healthy behaviors that may reduce the risk of cognitive decline and promote and protect cognitive health; and

subparagraph.text: by inserting , across public and private sectors, after Nation's progress; and
by inserting , including consideration of public-private collaborations, as appropriate before the period;

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by adding at the end the following:
A designee of the Department of Justice.
A designee of the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
A designee of the Social Security Administration.
A designee of the Office of Management and Budget.

item.text: by striking 2 researchers and inserting 3 researchers; and
by striking ; and and inserting , including at least one researcher with demonstrated experience in recruitment and retention of diverse cohorts of trial participants;;

subclause.text: in clause (vi), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: an individual with a diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease.

subclause.text: by striking an initial evaluation and inserting annual evaluations; and
by striking research, clinical and inserting research, risk reduction, public health, clinical;
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking initial; and
in clause (ii), by inserting and reduce disparities before the semicolon; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking annually thereafter, an evaluation and inserting annual evaluations; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (6), by striking 2025 and inserting 2035;

paragraph.text: in subsection (g)(3)(A)(ii), by inserting and reduce disparities before the semicolon; and
in subsection (h), by striking 2025 and inserting 2035.
